problem.title: Your Website Should Help Your Business, Not Hurt It.
problem.intro: For many small business owners, a website can feel like a confusing, expensive, and time-consuming problem. You might be wondering:

questions.title: Am I reaching the right customers?
questions.description: If your website isn't optimized for search engines like Google and AI assistants like ChatGPT, you're likely invisible to potential customers looking for your products or services.

questions.title: Is my website turning people away?
questions.description: A slow, confusing, or broken website frustrates visitors and sends them straight to your competitors.

questions.title: Could my website get me in legal trouble?
questions.description: Many business owners are unaware that their websites are legally required to be accessible to people with disabilities. This can lead to expensive lawsuits.

agitate.title: Ignoring Your Website's Problems is Costly.
agitate.content: An unhealthy website isn't just a missed opportunity; it's a direct threat to your bottom line.
